metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1320 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The SeaMicro provisioning of Ubuntu MAAS logs credentials, including username and password, for the management interface. This issue affects Ubuntu MAAS versions prior to 1.9.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1320` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

maas - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
maas-cli - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
maas-cluster-controller - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
maas-common - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
maas-dhcp - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
maas-dns - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
maas-proxy - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
maas-region-controller - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
maas-region-controller-min - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
python-django-maas - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
python-maas-client - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
python-maas-provisioningserver - 1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: maas package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.5+bzr4599-0ubuntu1~14.04.1').
